Comment: There is speculation that the main reason Kamala Harris was picked is because she was already on the ticket. By FEC law, you can’t just hand campaign funds over to a new candidate unless they were officially part of the original campaign.  Since Harris was already listed on the Biden-Harris team, she could legally take over the campaign and access the $90 million that had been raised. If she had decided not to run, that money couldn’t be used by anyone else. It would’ve had to be sent back to donors, given to political groups or charities, or used to pay off campaign expenses.   Losing $90 million that late in the game would have been a huge hit to the party. They worked with what they had.
